references.paper_title: Convolutional neural networks for inverse problems in imaging: A review
references.reason: This paper provides a comprehensive overview of the use of convolutional neural networks in solving inverse problems in imaging, which is the primary focus of the current research.
This paper introduces the Deep Image Prior (DIP) method, which serves as the foundation for the current work and is extensively discussed throughout the paper.
This paper introduces denoising diffusion probabilistic models (DDPMs), a class of generative models that are compared to the proposed method in terms of performance and efficiency.

references.paper_title: Score-based diffusion models for accelerated MRI
references.reason: This paper presents a state-of-the-art diffusion model for accelerated MRI reconstruction, which is used as a baseline and compared against the proposed method.

references.paper_title: Improving diffusion models for inverse problems using manifold constraints
references.reason: This paper introduces improvements to diffusion models for solving inverse problems, which are relevant to the current work and are used as a baseline for comparison.
